description: Italy's political stalemate may finally be over. Enrico Letta, of the center-left Democratic Party, has been nominated as the country's next prime minister and will try to move away from austerity. Earnings season continues today, and so far most companies have reported positive results. But should we buy it? The history of 'Take our Daughters to Work Day' and why it now includes sons.
title: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday, April 25, 2013
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday, April 25, 2013
teaser: Italy's political stalemate may finally be over. Enrico Letta, of the center-left Democratic Party, has been nominated as the country's next prime minister and will try to move away from austerity. Earnings season continues today, and so far most companies have reported positive results. But should we buy it? The history of 'Take our Daughters to Work Day' and why it now includes sons.
byline: Janell Burley Hofmann, David Gura, Shannon Mullen, Queena Kim, Stacey Vanek Smith, Sam Beard, Allan Sloan, Jeremy Hobson and Noel King
